data.title: SummerSlam
data.text:
SummerSlam 1988

August 29, 1988 in New York City, NY

Madison Square Garden drawing 20,000 ($355,345)

Shown live on PPV (4.5)

The British Bulldogs drew Jacques & Raymond Rougeau (20:00).

Bad News Brown pinned Ken Patera (6:33).

Rick Rude beat Junkyard Dog (6:18) via DQ.

The Powers of Pain beat Nikolai Volkoff & Boris Zuhkov (5:27) when Barbarian pinned Zuhkov.

"Brother Love Show" with Jim Duggan.

Ultimate Warrior pinned Honkytonk Man (0:31) to win the WWF I-C Title.

Dino Bravo pinned Don Muraco (5:28).

WWF Tag Champs Demolition Axe & Smash beat The Hart Foundation (9:49) when Smash pinned Hart.

Big Boss Man pinned Koko B. Ware (5:57).

Jake Roberts pinned Hercules (10:06).

Hulk Hogan & Randy Savage beat Andre the Giant & Ted DiBiase (13:57) when Savage pinned DiBiase. Jesse Ventura was the special referee.

Return to top of page

SummerSlam 1989

August 28, 1989 in East Rutherford, NJ

Meadowlands Arena drawing 20,000 ($350,000)

Shown live on PPV (4.8)

Arn Anderson & Tully Blanchard beat The Hart Foundation (16:23) when Blanchard pinned Hart.

Dusty Rhodes pinned Honkytonk Man (9:36).

Mr. Perfect pinned Red Rooster (3:21).

Rick Martel, Jacques & Raymond Rougeau beat The Rockers & Tito Santana (14:58) when Martel pinned Jannetty.

Ultimate Warrior pinned Rick Rude (16:02) to win the WWF I-C Title.

Demolition Axe & Smash & Jim Duggan beat Andre the Giant, Akeem, & Big Boss Man (7:23) when Smash pinned Akeem.

Hercules beat Greg Valentine (3:08) via DQ.

Ted DiBiase beat Jimmy Snuka (6:27) via countout.

Hulk Hogan & Brutus Beefcake beat Randy Savage & Zeus (15:04) when Hogan pinned Zeus.

Return to top of page

SummerSlam 1990

August 27, 1990 in Philadelphia, PA

The Spectrum drawing 19,304 ($338,452)

Shown live on PPV (3.8)

Hercules & Paul Roma beat The Rockers (6:00) via countout.

Kerry Von Erich pinned Mr. Perfect (5:15) to win the WWF I-C Title.

Sherri Martel beat Sapphire via forfeit.

Warlord pinned Tito Santana (5:28).

The Hart Foundation beat Demolition Smash & Crush in three falls to win the WWF Tag Title.

Crush pinned Hart (6:09).

Demolition was DQed (10:06).

Hart pinned Crush (14:24).

Jake Roberts beat Bad News Brown (4:44) via DQ.

"Brother Love Show" with Sgt. Slaughter.

Jim Duggan & Nikolai Volkoff beat The Orient Express (Sato & Tanaka) (3:22) when Duggan pinned Tanaka.

Randy Savage pinned Dusty Rhodes (2:15).

Hulk Hogan beat Earthquake (13:16) via countout.

WWF World Champ Ultimate Warrior beat Rick Rude (10:05) in a "steel cage" match.

Return to top of page

SummerSlam 1991

"The Match Made in Heaven/The Match Made in Hell"

August 26, 1991 in New York City, NY

Madison Square Garden drawing 20,000 ($404,150)

Shown live on PPV (2.7)

Koko B. Ware pinned Kato (6:03).

Davey Smith, Ricky Steamboat, & Kerry Von Erich beat Paul Roma, Hercules, & Warlord (10:43) when Steamboat pinned Roma.

Bret Hart beat Mr. Perfect (18:04) via submission to win the WWF I-C Title.

Irwin R. Schyster pinned Greg Valentine (7:07).

Earthquake & Typhoon beat The Bushwhackers (6:27) when Earthquake pinned Williams.

Big Boss Man pinned The Mountie (9:38) in a "jailhouse" match.

Virgil pinned Ted DiBiase (13:11) to win the Million Dollar Belt.

The Legion of Doom beat The Nasty Boys (7:45) to win the WWF Tag Title when Animal pinned Sags.

Hulk Hogan & Ultimate Warrior beat Gen Adnan, Col Mustafa, & Sgt Slaughter (12:40) in a "handicap" match when Hogan pinned Slaughter. Sid Justice was the special referee.

The "wedding" of Randy Savage & Elizabeth.

Return to top of page

SummerSlam 1992

August 29, 1992 in London, England

Wembley Stadium drawing 78,927 ($2,200,000)

Shown August 31, 1992 on PPV (1.5)

Papa Shango pinned Tito Santana (6:00).

Tatanka pinned The Berzerker (5:46).

The Bushwhackers & Jim Duggan beat The Nasty Boys & The Mountie (12:33) when Duggan pinned The Mountie.

The Legion of Doom beat Irwin R. Schyster & Ted DiBiase (15:10) when Animal pinned DiBiase.

Nailz beat Virgil (3:55) via sleeperhold.

Shawn Michaels DCO Rick Martel (8:06).

WWF Tag Champs Earthquake & Typhoon beat The Beverly Brothers (10:30) when Earthquake pinned Beau.

Crush beat Repoman (5:41) via submission.

Ultimate Warrior beat WWF World Champ Randy Savage (28:00) via countout.

The Undertaker beat Kamala (3:27) via DQ.

Davey Smith pinned Bret Hart (25:40) to win the WWF I-C Title.

Return to top of page

SummerSlam 1993

August 30, 1993 in Auburn Hills, MI

The Palace drawing 14,000 ($215,000)

Shown live on PPV (1.3)

Owen Hart pinned Barry Horowitz (8:32).

Razor Ramon pinned Ted DiBiase (7:32).

WWF Tag Champs Rick & Scott Steiner beat The Heavenly Bodies (Del Ray & Pritchard) (9:28) when Rick pinned Del Rey.

WWF I-C Champ Shawn Michaels beat Mr. Perfect (11:20) via countout.

Irwin R. Schyster pinned The 1-2-3 Kid (5:44).

Bret Hart beat Doink (9:05) via submission.

Jerry Lawler beat Bret Hart (6:32) via DQ.

Ludwig Borga beat Marty Jannetty (5:15) via submission.

The Undertaker pinned Giant Gonzales (8:04) in a "rest in peace" match.

The Smoking Gunns & Tatanka beat Bam Bam Bigelow & Headshrinkers Fatu & Samu (11:15) when Tatanka pinned Samu.

Lex Luger beat WWF World Champ Yokozuna (17:58) via countout.

Return to top of page

SummerSlam 1994

August 29, 1994 in Chicago, IL

United Center drawing 23,000 ($386,000)

Shown live on PPV (1.3)

Adam Bomb beat Kwang.

Irwin R. Schyster & Bam Bam Bigelow beat Headshrinkers Samu & Fatu (6:45) via DQ.

WWF Women's Champ Alundra Blayze pinned Bull Nakano (8:10).

Razor Ramon (seconded by Walter Payton) pinned Diesel (13:55) to win the WWF I-C Title.

Tatanka pinned Lex Luger (6:00).

Jeff Jarrett pinned Mabel (5:45).

WWF World Champ Bret Hart beat Owen Hart (32:17) in a "steel cage" match.

The Undertaker pinned The Undertaker II (8:57).

Guests: Leslie Nielson, George Kennedy

Return to top of page

SummerSlam 1995

August 27, 1995 in Pittsburgh, PA

Civic Arena drawing 18,062 ($353,705)

Shown live on PPV (0.9)

Hakushi pinned The 1-2-3 Kid (9:28).

Hunter Hearst Helmsley pinned Bob Holly (7:11).

The Smoking Gunns beat Eli & Jacob Blue (6:10) when Bart made the pin.

Barry Horowitz pinned Skip (11:21).

Bertha Faye pinned Alundra Blayze (4:37) to win the WWF Women's Title.

The Undertaker beat Kama (16:26) in a "casket" match.

Bret Hart beat Isaac Yankem (16:08) via DQ.

WWF I-C Champ Shawn Michaels beat Razor Ramon (24:58) in a "ladder" match.

WWF World Champ Diesel pinned Mabel (9:15).

Return to top of page

SummerSlam 1996

August 18, 1996 in Cleveland, OH

Gund Arena drawing 17,000 ($413,168)

Shown live on PPV (0.58)

Steve Austin pinned Yokozuna (1:52).

Owen Hart KO Savio Vega (13:23).

WWF Tag Champs The Smoking Gunns beat The New Rockers, Phineas & Henry Godwinn, and The Bodydonnas (12:18) in a "four corners" match.

Billy pinned Zip (4:00).

Henry pinned Cassidy (7:18).

Billy pinned Phineas (12:18).

Sycho Sid pinned Davey Smith (6:24).

Goldust pinned Marc Mero (11:01).

Jerry Lawler pinned Jake Roberts (4:07).

Mankind beat The Undertaker (26:40) in a "boiler room brawl" match. Half of this match was pre-taped.

WWF World Champ Shawn Michaels pinned Vader (18:59).

Return to top of page

SummerSlam 1997

"Hart & Soul"

August 3, 1997 in East Rutherford, NJ

Continental Arena drawing 20,213 ($523,154)

Shown live on PPV (0.80)

Mankind beat Hunter Hearst Helmsley (16:25) in a "steel cage" match.

Goldust pinned Brian Pillman (7:15). As a result, Pillman must wear a dress on Raw.

The Legion of Doom beat Henry & Phineas Godwinn (9:51) when Hawk pinned Phineas.

WWF European Champ Davey Smith beat Ken Shamrock (7:29) via DQ.

Los Boricuas beat The Disciples of the Apocolypse (9:07) when Perez pinned Chainz.

Steve Austin pinned Owen Hart (16:16) to win the I-C Title.

Bret Hart pinned The Undertaker (28:09) to win the WWF World Title. Shawn Michaels was the special referee.

Return to top of page

SummerSlam 1998

August 30, 1998 in New York City, NY

Madison Square Garden drawing 21,588 ($796,853)

Shown live on PPV (1.63)

Scott Taylor & Brian Christopher beat LOD 2000 (2:15) when Taylor pinned Animal.

Gangrel pinned Dustin Runnels (2:30).

Skull & Eight Ball beat Justin Bradshaw & Vader (2:54) when Skull pinned Vader.

WWF European Champ D-Lo Brown beat Val Venis (15:24) via DQ.

Kurrgan, Golga, & Giant Silva beat Taka Michinoku, Mens Teioh, Shoichi Funaki, & Dick Togo (10:10) in a "handicap" match when Golga pinned all of Kaientai.

X-Pac pinned Jeff Jarrett (11:11) in a "hair vs. hair" match.

Sable & Edge beat Marc Mero & Jacquelyn (8:26) when Sable pinned Mero.

Ken Shamrock beat Owen Hart (9:16) via submission in a "lion's den" match. This match was held in an adjacent theater and drew 2,522 ($32,688).

Billy Gunn & Jesse Jammes beat Mankind (5:16) in a "handicap falls count anywhere" match to win the WWF Tag Title when Mankind was pinned.

Hunter Hearst Helmsley beat Rocky Maivia (26:01) in a "ladder" match to win the WWF I-C Title.

WWF World Champ Steve Austin pinned The Undertaker (20:52).

Return to top of page

SummerSlam 1999

"An Out of Body Experience"

August 22, 1999 in Minneapolis, MN

Target Center drawing 17,370 ($557,129)

Shown live on PPV (1.61)

Jeff Jarrett pinned D-Lo Brown (7:27) to win the WWF I-C and European Title.

Farooq & Bradshaw won a "king of the hill" (not called that) match.

Edge & Christian beat Matt & Jeff Hardy (5:02) when Christian pinned Matt.

Edge & Christian beat Mideon & Viscera (1:59) when Edge pinned Mideon.

Edge & Christian beat Droz & Prince Albert (1:49) when Edge pinned Albert.

Farooq & Bradshaw beat Cristian & Edge (4:45) when Bradshaw pinned Christian.

Farooq & Bradshaw beat Bob & Crash Holly (2:48) when Farooq pinned Bob.

Al Snow pinned Big Bossman (7:27) to win the WWF Hardcore Title.

WWF Women's Champ Ivory pinned Tori (4:08).

Ken Shamrock KO Steve Blackman (9:06) in a "lion's den" match.

Test pinned Shane McMahon (12:04).

The Undertaker & Big Show beat Kane & X-Pac (12:01) to win the WWF Tag Title when Undertaker pinned X-Pac.

The Rock pinned Billy Gunn (10:12) in a "kiss my ass" match.

Mankind beat Steve Austin and Hunter Hearst Helmsley (16:23) in a "triangle" match to win the WWF World Title when he pinned Austin.

Return to top of page

SummerSlam 2000

August 27, 2000 in Raleigh, NC

Entertainment & Sports Complex drawing 17,002 ($1,151,940)

Shown live on PPV (1.4)

Stevie Richards, The Goodfather, & Bull Buchanan beat Too Cool & Rikishi (5:12) when Richards pinned Hotty.

X-Pac pinned Road Dogg (4:42).

Eddie Guerrero & Chyna beat Val Venis & Trish Stratus (7:13) when Chyna pinned Stratus. As a result, Chyna won the WWF I-C Title.

Jerry Lawler pinned Tazz (4:24).

Steve Blackman pinned Shane McMahon (10:08) to win the WWF Hardcore Title.

Chris Benoit beat Chris Jericho (13:02) in three falls.

Benoit forced Jericho to submit (3:15).

Jericho forced Benoit to submit (8:25).

Benoit pinned Jericho (13:02).

WWF Tag Champs Edge & Christian beat The Dudley Boyz and Matt & Jeff Hardy (14:51) in a "table, ladders, & chairs" match.

The Kat beat Terri (3:06) in a "stink face" match.

The Undertaker NC Kane (6:28).

WWF World Champ The Rock beat Kurt Angle and Triple H (20:09) in a "triple threat" match when he pinned Triple H.

Return to top of page

SummerSlam 2001

August 19, 2001 in San Jose, CA

Compaq Center drawing 15,293 ($907,105)

Shown live on PPV (1.05)

Jacqueline, Molly Holly, & Lita beat Stacey Keibler, Torrie Wilson, & Ivory (2:55) when Jacqueline pinned Ivory.

Edge pinned Lance Storm (11:16) to win the WWF I-C Title.

Test, Bubba Ray & D-Von Dudley beat The Acolytes & Spike Dudley (7:19) when Test pinned Bradshaw.

WCW Cruiserweight Champ X-Pac pinned Yoshihiro Tajiri (7:330 to win the WWF Light Heavyweight Title.

Chris Jericho beat Rhyno (12:34) via submission.

Rob Van Dam pinned Jeff Hardy (16:33) to win the WWF Hardcore Title.

WCW Tag Champs The Undertaker & Kane beat Diamond Dallas Page & Chris Kanyon (10:13) in a "steel cage" match to win the WWF Tag Title when Undertaker pinned Page.

Kurt Angle beat WWF World Champ Steve Austin (22:30) via DQ.

The Rock pinned Booker T (15:19) to win the WCW World Title.

Return to top of page

SummerSlam 2002

August 25, 2002 in Uniondale, NY

Nassau Coliseum drawing 14,797 ($893,625)

Shown live on PPV (1.00)

Spike Dudley pinned Steven Richards (2:35).

Kurt Angle beat Rey Misterio (9:20) via submission.

Ric Flair beat Chris Jericho (10:22) via submission.

Edge pinned Eddie Guerrero (11:47).

WWE Tag Champs Lance Storm & Christian beat Booker T & Goldust (9:37) when Test was pinned.

Rob Van Dam pinned Chris Benoit (16:30) to win the WWE I-C Title.

The Undertaker pinned Test (8:18).

Shawn Michaels pinned Triple H (27:20) in a "non-sanctioned" match.

Brock Lesnar pinned The Rock (16:01) to win the WWE World Title.

Return to top of page

SummerSlam 2003

August 24, 2003 in Phoenix, AZ

Southwest Airlines Arena drawing 16,113 ($715,000)

Shown live on PPV (0.88)

Matt Hardy beat Zach Gowen (0:00) via forfeit.

Rey Mysterio pinned Shannon Moore (1:59).

World Tag Champs Sylvan Grenier & Rene Dupre beat Bubba Ray & D-Von Dudley (7:49) when Dupre pinned D-Von.

The Undertaker pinned A-Train (9:19).

Shane McMahon pinned Eric Bischoff (10:35).

WWE U.S. Champ Eddie Guerrero beat Rhyno, Chris Benoit, and Yoshihiro Tajiri (10:50) in a "fatal four way" match when he pinned Rhyno.

WWE Champ Kurt Angle beat Brock Lesnar (21:19) via submission.

Kane pinned Ron Van Dam (12:50).

World Champ Triple H beat Chris Jericho, Shawn Michaels, Bill Goldberg, Randy Orton, and Kevin Nash (19:15) in an "elimination chamber" match.

Jericho pinned Nash (8:16).

Goldberg pinned Orton (13:02).

Goldberg pinned Michaels (15:22).

Goldberg pinned Jericho (16:06).

Triple H pinned Goldberg (19:15).

Return to top of page

SummerSlam 2004

August 15, 2004 in Toronto, ON

Air Canada Center drawing 17,640 ($1,000,000)

Shown live on PPV (0.69)

Rob Van Dam pinned Rene Dupre (9:35).

Bubba, D-Von, & Spike Dudley beat Paul London, Billy Kidman, & Rey Mysterio (8:06) when Spike pinned Kidman.

Kane pinned Matt Hardy (6:08) in a match where the winner will marry Lita.

John Cena pinned Booker T (6:25).

WWE I-C Champ Edge beat Chris Jericho and Batista (8:26) in a "triple threat" match when he pinned Jericho.

Kurt Angle beat Eddie Guerrero (13:38) via submission.

Triple H pinned Eugene (14:06).

WWE Champ John Bradshaw Layfield beat The Undertaker (17:37) via DQ.

Randy Orton pinned Chris Benoit (20:08) to win the World Title.

Return to top of page

SummerSlam 2005

August 21, 2005 in Washington, DC

MCI Center drawing 15,700 ($834,000)

Shown live on PPV

Chris Masters beat Hurricane (1:56) via submission.

Chris Benoit beat Orlando Jordan (0:25) via submission to win the WWE U.S. Title.

Edge TKO Matt Hardy (4:50).

Rey Mysterio beat Eddie Guerrero (20:19) in a "ladder" match to win custody of Dominick (Rey's son).

Kurt Angle beat Eugene (4:31) via submission.

Randy Orton pinned The Undertaker (17:17).

WWE Champ John Cena pinned Chris Jericho (14:49).

World Champ Batista pinned John Bradshaw Layfield (9:05) in a "no holds barred" match.

Hulk Hogan pinned Shawn Michaels (21:24).

Return to top of page

SummerSlam 2006

August 20, 2006 in Boston, MA

TD Banknorth Arena drawing 16,168 ($800,000)

Shown live on PPV

Carlito pinned Rob Conway (4:20).

Chavo Guerrero pinned Rey Mysterio (10:59).

ECW Champ The Big Show pinned Sabu (8:30).

Hulk Hogan pinned Randy Orton (10:56).

Ric Flair beat Mick Foley (12:47) via submission in an "I quit" match.

Batista beat World Champ Booker T (10:30) via DQ.

Shawn Michaels & Triple H beat Vince & Shane McMahon (13:02) when Triple H pinned Vince.

WWE Champ Edge pinned John Cena (15:41) in a match where the title could change hands via DQ.

Return to top of page

SummerSlam 2007

August 26, 2007 in East Rutherford, NJ

Continental Airlines Arena drawing 16,000 ($1,000,000)

Shown live on PPV

Lance Cade & Trevor Murdoch beat Brian Kendrick & Paul London when Cade pinned Kendrick.

Kane pinned Fit Finlay (8:48).

WWE I-C Champ Umaga beat Mr. Kennedy and Carlito (7:22) in a "triple threat" match when he pinned Kennedy.

Rey Mysterio pinned Chavo Guerrero (12:05).

Beth Phoenix won a "battle royal" (7:06). Also in the match were: Brooke Adams, Jillian Hall, Mickie James, Kelly Kelly, Layla El, Maria, Kristal Marshall, Michelle McCool, Melina, Victoria, and Torrie Wilson.

ECW Champ John Morrison pinned CM Punk (7:07).

Triple H pinned Booker T (7:56).

Batista beat World Champ The Great Khali (6:57) via DQ.

WWE Champ John Cena pinned Randy Orton (21:19).

Return to top of page

SummerSlam 2008

August 17, 2008 in Indianapolis, IN

Conseco Fieldhouse drawing 12,480 ($802,810)

Shown live on PPV

The Big Show pinned Bam Neely.

MVP pinned Jeff Hardy (19:12).

Santino Marrella & Beth Phoenix beat Kofi Kingston & Mickie James (5:40) when Phoenix pinned James. As a result Marrella won the WWE I-C Title and Phoenix won the WWE Women's Title.

Shawn Michaels and Chris Jericho interview. This segment included Jericho punching Michaels' wife.

Matt Hardy beat ECW Champ Mark Henry (0:33) via DQ.

World Champ CM Punk pinned John Bradshaw Layfield (11:12).

WWE Champ Triple H pinned The Great Khali (9:18).

Batista pinned John Cena (13:41).

The Undertaker pinned Edge (26:43) in a "hell in a cell" match.

Return to top of page

SummerSlam 2009

August 23, 2009 in Los Angeles, CA

Staples Center drawing 14,116 ($913,880)

Shown live on PPV

Beth Phoenix won a "battle royal."

WWE I-C Champ Rey Mysterio pinned Dolph Ziggler (12:26).

MVP pinned Jack Swagger (6:22).

WWE Unified Tag Champs Chris Jericho & The Big Show beat Cryme Tyme (9:42) when Jericho pinned JTG.

Kane pinned The Great Khali (5:56).

Shawn Michaels & Triple H beat Ted DiBiase, Jr. & Cody Rhodes (19:59) when Michaels pinned Rhodes.

ECW Champ Christian pinned William Regal (0:08).

WWE Champ Randy Orton pinned John Cena (20:44).

CM Punk beat Jeff Hardy (19:40) in a "ladder" match to win the World Title.

Return to top of page

SummerSlam 2010

August 15, 2010 in Los Angeles, CA

Staples Center drawing 14,178 ($922,600)

Shown live on PPV

Evan Bourne pinned Zack Ryder.

WWE I-C Champ Dolph Ziggler NC Kofi Kingston (7:09).

WWE Divas Champ Melina pinned Alicia Fox (5:21).

The Big Show beat CM Punk, Luke Gallows, & Joseph Mercury (6:44) in a "handicap" match when he pinned Gallows & Mercury.

Randy Orton beat WWE Champ Seamus (18:56) via DQ.

World Champ Kane pinned Rey Mysterio (13:32).

John Cena, Daniel Bryan, Chris Jericho, Edge, R-Truth, John Morrison, & Bret Hart beat Wade Barrett, David Otunga, Heath Slater, Skip Sheffield, Darren Young, Michael Tarver, & Justin Gabriel (35:19) in an "elimination" match. Cena was the sole survivor.

Bryan forced Young to submit (0:45).

Morrison pinned Tarver (3:36).

Sheffield pinned Morrison (7:34).

Sheffield pinned R-Truth (7:59).

Hart was DQed (12:10).

Edge pinned Sheffield (13:14).

Jericho forced Otunga to submit (19:16).

Slater pinned Jericho (20:05).

Slater pinned Edge (20:39).

Bryan forced Slater to submit (29:02).

Barrett pinned Bryan (29:32).

Cena pinned Gabriel (24:51).

Cena forced Barrett to submit (35:19).

Return to top of page

SummerSlam 2011

August 14, 2011 in Los Angeles, CA

Staples Center drawing 17,404 ($1,008,150)

Shown live on PPV

Dolph Ziggler pinned Alex Riley.

Rey Mysterio, Kofi Kingston, & John Morrison beat Alberto Del Rio, The Miz, & R-Truth (9:33) when Mysterio pinned Truth.

Mark Henry beat Sheamus (9:20) via countout.

WWE Divas Champ Kelly Kelly pinned Beth Phoenix (6:31).

Wade Barrett pinned Daniel Bryan (11:46).

Randy Orton pinned Christian (23:41) in a "no holds barred" match to win the World Title.

CM Punk pinned John Cena (24:10) to win the WWE Title. Triple H was the referee.

Alberto Del Rio pinned CM Punk (0:12) to win the WWE Title.

Return to top of page

SummerSlam 2012

August 19, 2012 in Los Angeles, CA

Staples Center drawing 14,205 ($1,135,590)

Shown live on PPV

Antonio Cesaro pinned Santino Marella to win the WWE U.S. Title. This match aired online.

Chris Jericho pinned Dolph Ziggler (13:04).

Daniel Bryan pinned Kane (8:02).

WWE I-C Champ The Miz pinned Rey Mysterio (9:08).

World Champ Sheamus pinned Alberto Del Rio (12:00).

WWE Tag Champs Kofi Kingston & R-truth beat Titus O'Neil & Darren Young (7:05) when Truth pinned Young.

WWE Champ CM Punk beat The big Show and John Cena (12:36) in a "triple threat" match when he pinned Show.

Brock Lesnar beat Triple H (18:45) via submission.

Return to top of page

SummerSlam 2013

August 18, 2013 in Los Angeles, CA

Staples Center drawing 14,500

Shown live on PPV

Rob Van Dam beat WWE U.S. Champ Dean Ambrose (13:38) via DQ. This match aired online.

Bray Wyatt pinned Kane (7:48) in a "ring of fire" match.

Cody Rhodes pinned Damien Sandow (6:39).

World Champ Alberto Del Rio pinned Christian (12:27).

Natalya pinned Brie Bella (5:16).

Brock Lesnar pinned CM Punk (25:14) in a "no DQ" match.

Dolph Ziggler & Kaitlyn beat Big E. Langston & AJ Lee (6:44) when Ziggler pinned Langston.

Daniel Bryan pinned John Cena (27:05) to win the WWE World Title.

Randy Orton pinned Daniel Bryan (0:07) to win the WWE World Title.

Return to top of page

SummerSlam 2014

August 17, 2014 in Los Angeles, CA

Staples Center drawing 14,000

Shown live on PPV & WWE Network

Rob Van Dam pinned Cesaro (8:12).

Dolph Ziggler pinned The Miz (7:50) to win the WWE I-C Title.

Paige pinned AJ Lee (4:52) to win the WWE Divas Title.

Rusev TKO Jack Swagger (8:54) in a "flag" match.

Seth Rollins pinned Dean Ambrose (10:50) in a "lumberjack" match.

Bray Wyatt pinned Chris Jericho (12:56).

Stephanie McMahon pinned Brie Bella (11:06).

Roman Reigns pinned Randy Orton (16:14).

Brock Lesnar pinned John Cena (16:05) to win the WWE World Title.

Return to top of page

SummerSlam 2015

August 23, 2015 in New York, NY

Barclays Center drawing 13,438

Shown live on PPV & WWE Network ($1,300,000)

Sheamus pinned Randy Orton (12:13).

Kofi Kingston & Big E beat Los Matadores, Titus O'Neil & Darren Young, and Sin Cara II & Kalisto (11:21) in a "fatal four way" match to win the WWE Tag Title when Kingston pinned a Fernando.

Dolph Ziggler DCO Rusev (11:50).

Neville & Stephen Amell beat Stardust & Wade Barrett (7:34) when Neville pinned Barrett.

WWE I-C Champ Ryback beat The big Show and The Miz (5:22) in a "triple threat" match when he pinned Miz.

Roman Reigns & Dean Ambrose beat Bray Wyatt & Luke Harper (10:56) when Reigns pinned Wyatt.

WWE World Champ Seth Rollins pinned John Cena (19:24) to win the WWE U.S. Title.

Paige, Charlotte, & Becky Lynch beat Alicia Fox, Brie & Nikki Bella and Sasha Banks, Tamina Snuka, & Cameron (15:17) in an "elimination" match.

Brie pinned Snuka (6:06).

Lynch pinned Brie 15:17).

Kevin Owens pinned Cesaro (14:16).

The Undertaker TKO Brock Lesnar (17:09).

Return to top of page

SummerSlam 2016

August 21, 2016 in New York, NY

Barclays Center drawing 15,128 ($1,506,514)

Shown live on PPV & WWE Network

Jason Jordan, Chad Gable, Zack Ryder, Mojo Rawley, Jimmy & Jey Uso beat Simon Gotch, Aiden English, Tyler Breeze, Fandango, & The Ascension (14:31) when Jey pinned Gotch.

Sami Zayn & Neville beat Bubba & D-Von Dudley (7:54) when Neville pinned Bubba.

Sheamus pinned Cesaro (14:09).

Chris Jericho & Kevon Owens beat Enzo Amore & Big Cass (12:07) when Jericho pinned Amore.

Charlotte pinned Sasha Banks (13:50) to win the WWE Divas Title.

WWE I-C Champ The Miz pinned Apollo Cruz (5:43).

AJ Styles pinned John Cena (23:02).

Doc Gallows & Karl Anderson beat WWE Tag Champs Kofi Kingston & Xavier Woods (9:06) via DQ.

WWE World Champ Dean Ambrose pinned Dolph Ziggler (15:17).

Nikki Bella, Natalya, & Alexa Bliss beat Carmella, Becky Lynch, & Naomi (11:01) when Bella pinned Carmella.

Finn Balor pinned Seth Rollins (19:22) to become the first WWE Universal Champ.

WWE U.S. Champ Rusev vs. Roman Reigns. The match never started due to Rusev being injured during the pre-match brawl.

Brock Lesnar TKO Randy Orton (11:46).

SummerSlam 2017

August 20, 2017 in New York, NY

Barclays Center drawing 13,200

Shown live on PPV & WWE Network

The Miz, Curtis Axel, & Bo Dallas beat Jason Jordan, Matt & Jeff Hardy(10:33) when Miz pinned Jordan.

Neville pinned Akira Tozawa (11:45) to win the WWE Cruiserweight Title.

Jimmy & Jey Uso beat Xavier Woods & Big E (19:13) to win the Smackdown Tag Title when Jey pinned Big E.

John Cena pinned Baron Corbin (10:12).

Natalya submitted Naomi (10:50) to win the Smackdown Women's Title.

Big Cass pinned The Big Show (10:27). Enzo Amore was suspended above the ring in a shark cage.

Randy Orton pinned Rusev (0:09).

Sasha Banks submitted Alex Bliss (13:15) to win the Raw Women's Title.

Finn Balor pinned Bray Wyatt (10:39).

Seth Rollins & Dena Ambrose beat Cesaro & Sheamus ((18:36) to win the Raw Tag Title when Ambrose pinned Sheamus.

WWE U.S. Champ AJ Styles pinned Kevin Owens (17:21). Shane McMahon was the referee.

WWE Champ Jinder Mahal pinned Shinsuke Nakamura (11:21).

WWE Universal Champ Brock Lesnar beat Roman Reigns, Braun Strowman, and Samoa Joe (21:01) in a "fatal four way" match when he pinned Reigns.

SummerSlam 2018

August 19, 2018 in New York, NY

Barclays Center drawing 14,000

Shown live on PPV & WWE Network

Andrade Cien almas & Zelina Vega beat Rusev & Lana (7:01) when Vega pinned Lana.

WWE Cruiserweight Champ Cedric Alexander pinned Drew Gulak (10:39).

WWE Raw tag Champs Bo Dallas & Curtis Axel beat Scott Dawson & Dash Wilder (6:11) when Axel pinned Dawson.

Seth Rollins pinned Dolph Ziggler (21:59) to win the WWE I-C Title.

Xavier Woods & Big E beat Smackdown Tag Champs Luke Harper & Erick Rowan (9:29) via DQ.

Braun Strowman pinned Kevin Owens (1:53).

Charlotte Flair beat Becky Lynch and Carmella (14:39) in a "triple threat" match to win the Smackdown Women's Title when she pinned Lynch.

Samoa Joe beat WWE World Champ AJ Styles(22:43) via DQ.

The Miz pinned Daniel Bryan (23:25).

Finn Balor pinned Baron Corbin (1:26).

WWE U.S. Champ Shinsuke Nakamura pinned Jeff Hardy 910:57).

Ronda Rousey submitted Alexa Bliss (4:39) to win the Raw Women's Title.

Roman Reigns pinned Brock Lesnar (6:07) to win the WWE Universal Title.

SummerSlam 2019

August 11, 2019 in Toronto, OH

Scotiabank Arena drawing 13,500

Shown live on PPV & WWE Network

WWE Cruiserweight Champ Drew Gulak pinned Oney Lorcan (8:47).

Buddy Murphy beat Apollo Crews (4:42) via DQ.

WWE Women's Tag Champs Nikki Cross & Alexa Bliss beat Billie Kay & Peyton Royce (6:10) when Bliss pinned Royce.

WWE Raw Women's Champ Becky Lynch beat Natalya (12:26) in a "submission" match.

WWE U.S. Champ AJ Styles pinned Ricochet (12:54).

Kevin Owens pinned Shane McMahon (9:21) in a match where Owens would retire if he lost.

Charlotte Flair submitted Trish Stratus (16:37).

Seth Rollins pinned Brock Lesnar (13:18) to win the WWE Universal Title.
